messages.title: On 7th May you have a clear choice:
messages.content: Either local hard working Lib Dem Gerald Vernon-Jackson will be our local MP...risk letting the Tories get away with their wicked cuts.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A further £400 income tax cut for 29,400 workers across the UK.
Putting the 'triple lock' on increasing pensions into law.
Continue to tackle the deficit - whilst creating more jobs.

mentions.tacticalSituation: It's extremely close between the Lib Dems and Conservatives in Portsmouth South. Only a vote for Gerald Vernon-Jackson can beat the Tories here.

issues.education: The education budget alone could be cut by up to £25 billion under Tory plans.

housing.content: Under his leadership, Portsmouth gained nearly 19,000 jobs between 2004-2013 and the city started building council houses again for the first time in a generation.

leaflet.personalStatement: Gerald has a 12 year track record of standing up for Portsmouth.

politicalExperience.achievements: Portsmouth gained nearly 19,000 jobs and started building council houses again for the first time in a generation.

images.caption: Stronger Economy. Fairer Society. Opportunity for Everyone.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The Tories' plans mean public services could be cut by £50 billion. Using textile bank charity cash to fill the controversial council budget.
